result.execSummary:
The defendant Moses Lee Sheffel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court
St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 read-in and dismissed.
Defendant to report to Probation by 9:30 a.m. April 25, 2016.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.
Defendant is entitled to 41 days credit under 973.155. 
Credit does not go towards stayed jail time.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #16CM116.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #16CM116.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Wal-Mart in New Richmond WI, Gregory Bowman or Peter Lacanter.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

supervisions.notes: Court costs to be added to current payment plan.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Minot. ADA:  Karl E. Anderson   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Moses Lee Sheffel appeared. Agent Volz appeared. Includes SEH on 17CF550, PAYH on 13FO483, 13CM577, 13FO479, 16CM119. Case called at 8:18 am. Court reviews file. Parties review PSI. Victim rights have been complied with. ADA Anderson makes recommendations. Atty Stormont responds. Court orders: 4 yrs probation i/s 7 years prison - 3 yrs i/c, 4 yrs e/s
- 4 months Jail. Huber for work and seek work
- Court Costs $268.00
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250.00. To be paid through probation
- Restitution $1,000.00. Reminder amount of restitution to be determined by a restitution hearing with court comissioner
- Def to complete MRT
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
  Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Mental Health Evalution
- Pay Supervision Fees
Credit fo 102 Days against ultimate sentence

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Moses Lee Sheffel appeared from jail. Includes 16CM62, 16CM72, 16CM119 and 16TR101. Case called at 9:52 am. There is an agreement. ADA Correll recites. No objection from Atty Stormont.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #2 in 16CM119.     Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #2 in 16CM119. 16CM62, 16CM72, Count #1 in 16CM119 and 16TR101 read in and dismissed read in for purposes of sentencing. Parties make sentencing arguments. Court questions Def. Court orders: 1 yr probation w/h with conditions - 
- 25 Days Jail STAYED. Credit does not go towards stayed jail time
- Court Costs - $243.00
- DNA Surcharge - $200.00. Apply Bond
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate motor vehicle without a valid license
- Not to possess a firearm
- No contact with Walmart in New Richmond, Gregory Bowman and Peter Lacanter
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Sign up for probation bt 9:30 am on 4/25/2016
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees

Per RMW 3/14/16 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif

INCLUDES 16CM62, 16CM72 & 16CM119

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sara W., Peter L., or Wal-Mart in New Richmond WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
